summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Western Union Financial Services, Inc., demanding records related to money transfers and money orders for an ongoing criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking and conspiracy. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Referred to in the subpoena and declaration as the prosecutor handling the request; the specific name is not provided in the text.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The FBI agent to whom the requested records from Western Union should be delivered if a personal appearance is not required.

persons.name: Forensic Accountant
persons.context: A contact person for questions regarding the subpoena, working with the FBI on the investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, oversees the Assistant U.S. Attorney who is conducting the investigation and issued the subpoena.
The prosecutor and the FBI agent are working together on the criminal investigation, as indicated by the subpoena delivery instructions.
Both are points of contact for the subpoena, suggesting they are part of the investigative team examining financial records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which Western Union must produce records or have a custodian appear before the grand jury.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena targets Western Union's records on money transfers and money orders, indicating a financial investigation into potential criminal activity.
The investigation involves alleged violations of federal laws including sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371), and coercion/enticement (18 U.S.C. ยง 2422(b)).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested non-disclosure of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.
The subpoena allows for records to be produced to an FBI Special Agent at 26 Federal Plaza in lieu of a personal appearance before the grand jury.
The document is part of the Epstein case data set, linking this financial investigation to the broader Jeffrey Epstein criminal case.
